#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Hold a Spoon
#Text=Although proper spoon use varies from culture to culture , you can learn a universal way to hold a spoon to allow for the widest field of motion .
#Text=The trick is to rest the spoon on your bottom three fingers and allow your wrist to do most of the work .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Gripping Your Spoon Properly
#Text=Use your dominant hand .
#Text=Most people use their right hand when reaching for a spoon .
#Text=However , you want to be able to control your motions carefully .
#Text=Therefore , it 's best to use your dominant hand .
#Text=Be careful if you 're sitting next to someone whose dominant hand is different from your own .
#Text=Be conscientious of your movements to avoid accidentally knocking elbows with them .
#Text=Hold the spoon horizontally .
#Text=You want to hold your spoon horizontally as you move it .
#Text=This will prevent food from spilling while you eat .
#Text=Keep your spoon steady with the first knuckle of your index finger and the tip of your middle finger , holding it at a horizontal angle .
#Text=Rest the handle across your middle finger .
#Text=Curl your middle finger , ring finger , and pinky fingers inward and lay the handle of the spoon overtop the middle finger , with the dome of the spoon pointing towards your other hand .
#Text=Rest the portion of the spoon 's handle right before the head on your index finger .
#Text=Allow the end of the handle to rest on the curve made by your thumb .
#Text=Hold the spoon in place with your thumb and index finger .
#Text=Place your thumb and index finger on top of the end of the spoon .
#Text=Press down on the end so that the spoon is held between the top of your middle finger and your thumb and index finger .
#Text=This should keep the spoon secure while you 're eating and drinking .
#Text=Eating with a Spoon
#Text=Turn your wrist to dip the spoon .
#Text=Holding the spoon like this allows you a greater field of motion .
#Text=When you turn your wrist away from you the spoon will dip downwards , into your food , and when you turn it towards you , the spoon will turn back up .
#Text=This is a more flexible position than if you held the spoon in , say , a fist , or between your thumb and index finger .
#Text=Use the side of the spoon .
#Text=Bring the spoon to your mouth and eat from the broad side of the spoon , rather than the tip .
#Text=You can use your wrist here to tilt the spoon upwards to aid in eating .
#Text=Eat slowly and gently .
#Text=Foods that you eat with a spoon are frequently liquid based .
#Text=It is easy to make slurping noises when eating with a spoon .
#Text=To minimize noise when eating , eat very slowly .
#Text=Make sure to open your mouth wide enough to get food in without having to resort to slurping .
#Text=Eating food slowly will also help you best enjoy the taste and texture of your food .
#Text=Keep your grip firm .
#Text=Make sure to grip firmly on your spoon when you eat .
#Text=Keeping a loose grip can cause you to drop your spoon , which can cause a mess and loud noises .
#Text=Keep your grip firm enough that the spoon does not wobble in your hands while you eat .
#Text=Following Proper Etiquette
#Text=Use your spoon for the right dishes .
#Text=Spoons are used to eat liquid-based food , such as soups .
#Text=Spoons are also used to eat mushier , softer foods such as ice cream and mashed potatoes .
#Text=Use your spoon for these types of foods and avoid using it to eat solid foods .
#Text=It can be hard to maneuver foods like meats and vegetables using a spoon .
#Text=Place your spoon on your plate when finished .
#Text=When you 're done , it 's customary to set your spoon down on your plate .
#Text=Always plate your spoon on the plate from which you were eating .
#Text=If you were eating soup , place the spoon on the plate your soup bowl was resting on .
#Text=In general , you should not place your spoon back in a bowl when you finish eating .
#Text=This could confuse waitstaff , as they may think you 're still eating .
#Text=However , if no plate was provided , it 's okay to put your spoon back in the bowl .
#Text=You do not want to get food residue on the table .
#Text=Do not use your fingers .
#Text=Never push food onto your spoon using your fingers .
#Text=This is considered bad table manners .
#Text=If you have to push food to eat with a spoon , it is probably better to use a fork for this type of food .
#Text=Avoid pointing with your spoon .
#Text=Never use your spoon to point at other guests while talking or otherwise gesticulating .
#Text=Only use your spoon for eating .
#Text=If you 're using your hands to do things like gesticulate while at the table , set your spoon down while doing so .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you are finishing a bowl of soup it is considered proper to tip the bowl away from your body , rather than toward .
#Text=This way drips are less likely to splash on your clothing .
#Text=Most soup spoons are not designed to fit inside the mouth .
#Text=Instead you must elegantly sip the soup from the bowl of the spoon .
#Text=Do not be too noisy when consuming the item off the spoon .
#Text=' Slurping ' soup and other items can be considered rude in some countries .
#Text=Quick Summary
